definitions.definition: if something is scarce, there is not enough of it and it is only available in small quantities

examples.text: Details of the accident are scarce.
Money was extremely scarce after the war.
Skilled workers were becoming increasingly scarce.
Butterflies are getting scarcer and scarcer in industrialized areas.
Land suitable for building on is scarce.

definitions.definition: to leave somewhere and stay away for a time in order to avoid an unpleasant situation

examples.text: I could see he was annoyed so I made myself scarce.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘restricted in quantity or size’, also ‘mean’): from a shortening of Anglo-Norman escars, from a Romance word meaning ‘plucked out, selected’.
